summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2021 between attorneys involved in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss identifying a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase and obtaining a trial subpoena for that witness.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding scheduling and witness matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, copied on emails regarding witness identification and scheduling in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual whom Allison Stoddart's team wishes to set up a call with; mentioned as traveling on specific dates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced throughout the email chain (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

connections.description: Corresponding as legal professionals on opposite sides (defense and prosecution) regarding trial logistics and witness matters.
Stoddart is arranging a call involving her team and Pat McHugh, indicating a professional association.
Sahni is an AUSA prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Jury selection is noted as being scheduled and underway, creating scheduling difficulties for the attorneys.

events.title: Witness Identification Discussions
events.description: Ongoing discussions between defense and prosecution attorneys about identifying an appropriate trial witness from JPMorgan Chase and obtaining a subpoena.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence shows active pre-trial coordination between defense and prosecution attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in late 2021.
A key logistical topic is identifying a witness from JPMorgan Chase to testify at trial, requiring a trial appearance subpoena.
Jury selection for the Maxwell trial was actively underway in November 2021, impacting attorney availability.
The emails reveal professional communication channels between WilmerHale (defense) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (prosecution).
